The agent is specifically seeking information about Jeffrey Epstein and another individual who attended. The agent initially contacted Thonn after finding a conference online and then attempted to gather information through the New Orleans Convention & Visitors Bureau and the 1-800-648-8411 conference hotline.  Details regarding the conference’s hotels and attendee records are being sought.

v. Epstein case (19 Cr. 490). *   Reid Weingarten, a defense attorney, is coordinating with government counsel ([REDACTED]) and Judge Berman’s chambers. *   Discussions revolve around the government's bail memorandum and the defendant’s motion for bail. *   Attendees express availability for meetings on Monday morning, with a proposed agenda. *   The government provided an attached document (Government’s reply in support of its detention memo and in opposition to the defendant’s motion for bail) filed this afternoon.

A Department Head Meeting was scheduled for Tuesday, August 13, 2019, at 7:30 A.M. in the Warden’s Conference Room. Attendees were requested to be present by 7:30 A.M. The meeting was sent by Lee.

An email chain discusses a visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on Thursday, August 13, 2019, at 10:00 AM. The purpose of the visit is to observe specific areas, including the E floor psych observation and suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein’s cell. MCC legal will escort the visitors, and they are instructed not to speak to guards due to ongoing investigations. The email chain coordinates logistics, including entry via the 3rd floor bridge and confirms the attendees: Mr. Berman and his staff.

An email chain discusses a visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on Thursday, August 14, 2019. The request includes a tour of specific areas – the 2nd floor psych observation and suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein’s cell – with a preference for MCC legal to escort the visitors.  A request was made for the new acting warden to join the tour. Visitors are instructed to report to the front lobby for screening. The sender confirms the request will be communicated to the Warden and provides a list of attendees, including Mr. Berman and his staff.

The Supervisory Attorney requested notification of attendees’ arrival.

Geoff scheduled a meeting for August 15, 2019, at 12:00 PM in the 8th floor library. Attendees included [REDACTED], [REDACTED], the MCC team, and representatives from the main justice, FBI, and IG departments. The meeting followed a visit by the MCC.

The document is a series of emails related to a planned visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) by US Attorney Geoffrey Berman and staff. Discussions involve coordinating the number and types of attendees (including paralegals and interns), arranging for law enforcement agents and a new acting warden to join the tour, and specifying the areas of interest for the visit (second floor observation areas, SHU, and Epstein’s cell). Requests were made for specific screening procedures and to limit interaction with guards due to ongoing investigations.
On August 16, 2019, at 2:00 PM, there was a meeting with the FBI regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The meeting lasted 30 minutes and was classified as X-PERSONAL. The event was created on August 15, 2019.

*   The meeting agenda has been revised to include a briefing with a new ODAG Liaison. *   Attendees are instructed to review their areas of responsibility and provide concise (5-minute or less) presentations. *   The Philadelphia hotel room block has been canceled, and attendees are responsible for canceling their travel arrangements. *   Meeting logistics are detailed, including the Hyatt Regency Washington location, room assignments (A-C training rooms), required identification (PIV card), and business casual attire. *   Weather forecasts and temperature ranges are provided. *   A fee of $25 will be collected for food expenses for the November 2019 meeting. *   PRD support staff will be available for assistance during the meeting.

An email was sent revising the agenda for an Executive Staff meeting scheduled for August 20, 2019, in Washington, DC. The meeting will include “Executive Staff Briefings to ODAG.” The Philadelphia hotel room block has been canceled, and attendees are responsible for canceling their own airfare/train arrangements. The meeting will be held in training rooms A-C on the first floor of the Hyatt Regency Washington on Capital Hill. Attendees are required to bring their government ID and PIV card. The dress attire is business casual, and the weather forecast is for warm, partly cloudy days. $25 will be collected from each attendee for food for the November 2019 meeting. PRD support staff will be available for assistance during the meeting.

An email was sent on August 26, 2019, regarding assistance for the upcoming hearing concerning Jeffrey Epstein. The sender requested volunteers to be on standby around 9:30/10 AM to assist victims, particularly those meeting at SDNY before the hearing. Attendees were instructed to wear suits due to a directive from higher-ups. The sender planned to provide further instructions regarding location (290) in the morning.

An event, titled “Nolle conference,” took place on August 27, 2019, from 14:30 to 15:00 at 500 Pearl, Courtroom 17B. The organizer was (USANYS) @usdoj.gov. Attendees included (USANYS) @usdoj.gov, (NY) (FBI) @fbi.gov, and @nypd.org. The event involved a status conference related to the case of USA v. Epstein (Case Number: 1:19-cr-00490-RMB) and a proposed nolle prosequi order, with Judge Richard M. Berman presiding. Counsel for the government, the deceased defendant, and potentially victims were scheduled to be heard.

Emails discuss next steps in an investigation, likely related to a case involving victims of Jeffrey Epstein. Key points include: *   A photo array is requested, potentially for interviews. *   A photo book will be used instead of a "6 pack." *   A victim conference in Miami is planned for October 15, 2019, and attendees are being considered. *   An FBI agent is coordinating with a lawyer to schedule interviews, potentially combining trips to Florida and New York. *   The team is seeking information on seized photos from both the Manhattan and Florida houses, including any discs with names on them.

The FBI Victim Services Division is offering an RSVP for a briefing regarding the Epstein case. The briefing is scheduled for October 15, 2019 in Miami, FL and October 23, 2019 in New York, NY. Attendees are required to complete a form collecting personal information, including contact details, citizenship, and travel preferences (transportation mode, dates, and airports). Attendees can bring one support person who also requires a separate form to be completed, including their personal details and travel preferences.  Lodging and mileage reimbursement are authorized, with specific restrictions on incidental charges and authorized expenses.  Attendees must acknowledge understanding of the limitations of authorized expenses, specifically excluding meals, rental vehicles, and entertainment.

A forwarded email from October 17, 2019, discusses a meeting in Florida involving Epstein victims, support persons, and attorneys. The meeting is expected to have 15 victims, 3 support persons, and 8 attorneys and is receiving positive feedback from attendees. The email references case file EFTA00028331.

An event titled “Epstein estate” took place on October 23, 2019, from 6:30 PM to 7:00 PM GMT. Marc A. Weinstein (redacted) organized the event via a Skype meeting with Conference ID 803 102 52. Attendees included Tomback, Andrew (redacted). A reminder was set to display 15 minutes before the start, including dial-in numbers for various countries: Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Ireland, Israel, Japan, Singapore, United Kingdom, United States. The document also provides instructions for joining the meeting via computer or mobile device, and offers troubleshooting steps via Skype Web App and the “Help” link. Additionally, it includes a dial-in PIN for a specific number (+12016300824).

An email chain discusses arrangements for a meeting involving three legal firms and FBI Victim Services Division regarding a briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein. Parking and transportation information are provided, and updates/questions should be submitted to a designated email inbox. The meeting's purpose is to be respectful and cooperative.

The FBI Victim Services Division is offering a briefing to victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The briefing will be held on October 15th in Miramar, Florida, or October 23rd in New York, NY. Attendees are asked to complete and return an RSVP Questionnaire to VictimServices@fbi.gov, providing personal information for security purposes. Transportation and lodging will be provided free of charge for those residing more than 50 miles from the location, with mileage reimbursement available for self-drivers. The meeting will involve FBI representatives, the FBI NY Field Office, and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
